summary: This is a court filing from a civil case (08-CV-80811) in the Southern District of Florida, where the plaintiff serves an amended answer to an interrogatory. The amended answer reveals that the FBI has photos of the plaintiff taken at Jeffrey Epstein's home, and that Epstein himself had photos taken of the plaintiff at his home. The document includes a list of attorneys involved.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a defendant in the civil case. The plaintiff's amended answer states that Epstein had photos taken of the plaintiff at his home.

persons.name: Jack A. Goldberger
persons.context: Listed as counsel for the plaintiff(s) from the law firm Atterbury, Goldberger & Weiss, P.A.

persons.name: Bruce E. Reinhart
persons.context: Listed as counsel, from Bruce E. Reinhart, P.A.

persons.name: Robert Critton
persons.context: Listed as counsel, from the law firm Burman Critton Luttier & Coleman LLP.

connections.description: Epstein is the defendant in a civil lawsuit where the plaintiff is making claims against him.
Goldberger is listed as an attorney representing the plaintiff(s) in the case.
The plaintiff's answer implies a non-consensual or controversial context by stating Epstein had photos taken of the plaintiff at his home, which is part of the legal controversy.

events.title: Service of First Interrogatories
events.description: Defendant Jeffrey Epstein's first set of interrogatories were propounded (served) on the plaintiff.

events.title: Filing of Amended Answer
events.description: The plaintiff files a notice with the court that an amended answer to Interrogatory #13 has been furnished to Epstein's attorney.

events.title: Photos Taken at Epstein's Home
events.description: The plaintiff states in the amended answer that the FBI has photos of them taken at Epstein's home, and that Epstein had photos taken of them at his home.

keyFacts: The plaintiff states that the FBI possesses photos of the plaintiff taken at Jeffrey Epstein's home.
The plaintiff states that Jeffrey Epstein himself had photos taken of the plaintiff at his home.
This is part of a civil case (08-CV-80811) filed in the Southern District of Florida.
The document is subject to a protective order, indicating sensitive or confidential information.
The amended answer was served on March 5, 2009, in response to interrogatories propounded on January 16, 2009.
